data.title: Louise Alexandra Marie Irene (Battenberg) Bernadotte (1889-1965)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Compare DNA and explore genealogy for Louise (Battenberg) Bernadotte born 1889 Schloss Heiligenberg, Seeheim-Jugenheim, Hesse, Germany died 1965 Saint Göran Hospital, Stockholm, Sweden including ancestors + 1 photos + 1 genealogist comments + mitochondrial DNA + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Ancestors

[children unknown]

Problems/Questions

Profile last modified 12 Jun 2024 | Created 27 Jul 2016

This page has been accessed 1,521 times.

Biography

1889 jul 13 Louise Alexandra Marie Irène Battenberg born at Schloss Heiligenberg[1][2]. Her father was Ludvig von Battenberg and her mother Victoria of Hessen, one of Queen Victoria of England's granddaughters[3][4]. She was born at the castle in Heidelberg but grew up in England.[5].

Picture from Arkiv Digital of Hovförsamlingen AIIa:8 (1911-1925)

Household records[1]

1921 nov 3 Louise married the crown prince Gustav Adolf of Sweden - his second marriage[3][4][5]. He had 5 children from his first marriage[1].

Marriage between Gustav VI Adolf and Louise Mountbatten

3 november 1923 in Chapel Royal i St. James's Palace in London.

1950 oct 30 after the death of king Gustav V, Louise became the queen of Sweden as her husband became the king of Sweden.[3]

The queen suffered from breast cancer and had several operations. In spite of this she followed her husband on his Eriksgata around the country.[3]

1965 mar 7 Louise passed away in 1965[3][4][6].

Space:Kungliga_begravningsplatsen
